item.title: At the Erith Road/ Mayplace road junction poor road surface, 23rd February
item.description:
This matter was reported about a month ago and there is still no blue marks at the junction as the road surface/ potholes need to be inspected and repaired to a suitable standard for all road users. The council states that they are spending 2.5 million on road repairs l don’t seem any improvement on the roads l just short term fixes and patch that’s not a long term fix
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistent fly-tipping from footbridge off Sayers Way, 23rd February
item.description:
Months of deliberately dumped waste collected below the footbridge off Sayers Way. Trolleys used to move waste. This is an on-going issue and getting worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frobisher Road, Slade Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous large potholes, 23rd February
item.description:
Numerous large potholes along the bottom half of Dickson road going into whinyates road. Loose stones from these holes keep rebounding into local cars parked.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dickson Road, Eltham

item.title: Outside Bexley office at the bus stop, 23rd February
item.description:
The road near the bus stop and the pedestrian crossing in Watling street has a few potholes/ poor road surface that requires attention and repair to make safe for road users
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Watling Street, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged play equipment. Still awaiting repair, 23rd February
item.description:
Play area in Russell Park requires repair -Zip wire has been out of use since late summer -Climbing frame is broken. Red warning tape has long since been broken by the weather/children. Children are still climbing and playing on this - serious accident waiting to happen. This has been at least 6 months One of the "rocking" animals is broken. Again warming tape had long since broken Also at least 6 months There are multiple reports, when are these items going to be fixed! This is a valuable resource for families but currently unsafe! Especially if children are there without an adult and unaware of the damaged areas
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping - bin bags, 23rd February
item.description:
2 fly tipped bin bags on Hawes Road near junction with palace road. Please clear

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hawes Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large sofas and other debris blocking pavement, 23rd February
item.description:
We have just witnessed a white van pull up opposite 170 Rydal and dump the contents including large furniture on the pavement completely blocking the pathway. My husband managed to take these photos as it happened 16.27 today.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 172, Rydal Drive, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gravel hill Ballards crossing debris, 23rd February
item.description:
Hi, l reported is last week, that the traffic island have been replaced, but there is debris/ rubbish around them that need to be removed and ensure all rubbish is cleared for safety reasons and still no action has been done today 23/02
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gravel Hill, Bexley, Greater London

item.title: House hold bins left on street, 23rd February
item.description:

item.title: Trailing cable across floor - major trip hazard, 23rd February
item.description:
Some form of utilities surfacing the building has left a cable trailing across the pedestrian walkway. Major trip hazard which has been there sometime but surely needs to be rectified. Very shoddy by whichever company has installed this

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Avery Hill Road, Avery Hill

item.title: Litter on Tabard street, 23rd February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tabard Street, The Borough, Greater London

item.title: KY18 ZSK Broken Down Royal Mail van, 23rd February
item.description:
This Royal Mail van has had an accident, is immobile with its front passenger wheel/side smashed in. The van is just currently left there unattended. Please can the council/Royal Mail look to collect it. Thanks.

item.title: Outside 203 Grays Inn Road, 23rd February
item.description:
The branches on this tree are getting dangerously close my property (the closest is around a foot from my balcony), and a number of larger branches have been falling down to the raised entrance porch over the last week or two. I can’t see any work being scheduled on this tree but wondered if there is any possibility of cutting this back a bit?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 201, Gray's Inn Road, King's Cross, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
